explanation: The reported violation is not correct for this function. The original MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3 implementation shown does not contain the statement '(void) upload_data;' (nor any other no-op-only expressions whose removal would not affect behaviour). All executed statements in the function perform observable actions (memory allocation, memcpy, MHD_str_quote, header addition, free, conditional response queuing, or return). The supplied modified test code likewise does not introduce such a no-op cast. Therefore there is no evidence of dead code as defined by MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 in the provided function. (The attempted test run failing to compile does not change this conclusion.)
